Another short way of finding pH of weak acids is: "pH=1/2 (pKa - log[HA]i)". Following this method I got pH of 2.875 (round up to 2.9) for the first example. The same thing goes for pOH; substituting pKa for pKb and [HA]i for [B]i respectively. Just a method I was taught, I thought it would be interesting to share. Love your videos, Chad! You helped me immensely
You videos are so easy to understand, you are the best.
